blocks.name: chscl
blocks.content: The subspace sum of two closed orthogonal spaces is closed. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-1999.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 19-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm chscl(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cph, c1), cch))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cch))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cch))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cfv(cort, c0)))
} = {
  sylanbrc(w0, wcel(co(c0, cph, c1), cch), wcel(co(c0, cph, c1), csh), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), co(c0, cph, c1))))))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(co(c0, cph, c1), csh), wcel(c0, csh), wcel(c1, csh))
  syl(w0, wcel(c0, csh), wcel(c0, cch))
  chsh(c0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, csh), wcel(c1, cch))
  chsh(c1)
  shscl(c0, c1)
  alrimivv(hs0, hs1, w0, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), co(c0, cph, c1))))
  ex(w0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), co(c0, cph, c1)))
  chscllem4(hs1, hs2, c0, c1, cv(hs0), cmpt(hs2, cn, cfv(cfv(cpjh, c0), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))), cmpt(hs2, cn, cfv(cfv(cpjh, c1), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))), wa(w0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1)))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(c0, cch))
  adantr(w0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(c1, cch))
  adantr(w0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, co(c0, cph, c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wss(c1, cfv(cort, c0)))

  eqid(cmpt(hs2, cn, cfv(cfv(cpjh, c0), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs2, cn, cfv(cfv(cpjh, c1), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))
  isch2(hs0, hs1, co(c0, cph, c1))

  diff.hs1.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)

  ex(w0, ((hs0 : ℕ →(c0[+H]c1))∧ hs0[~~>v]hs1), hs1 ∈(c0[+H]c1))

blocks.name: osumi
blocks.content: If two closed subspaces of a Hilbert space are orthogonal, their subspace sum equals their subspace join. Lemma 3 of [Kalmbach] p. 67. Note that the (countable) Axiom of Choice is used for this proof via ~ pjhth , although "the hard part" of this proof, ~ chscl , requires no choice. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm osumi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)))
  -| wcel(c0, cch)
  -| wcel(c1, cch)
} = {
  sylib(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cph, c1), cch))
  chscl(c0, c1, wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)))
  a1i(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wcel(c0, cch))
  a1i(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wcel(c1, cch))
  biimpi(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wss(c1, cfv(cort, c0)))
  chsscon2i(c0, c1)
  shjshseli(c0, c1)
  chshii(c0)
  chshii(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm osumi(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1)→(c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ CH
  ⊣ c1 ∈ CH
} = {
  sylib(c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), (c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1), (c0[+H]c1)∈ CH)
  chscl(c0, c1, c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1))
  a1i(c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), c0 ∈ CH)
  a1i(c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), c1 ∈ CH)
  biimpi(c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), c1 ⊆(_|_ ` c0))
  chsscon2i(c0, c1)
  shjshseli(c0, c1)
  chshii(c0)
  chshii(c1)
}

thm osumcori(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(co(cin(c0, c1), cph, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1))), co(cin(c0, c1), chj, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1))))
  -| wcel(c0, cch)
  -| wcel(c1, cch)
} = {
  ax-mp(wceq(co(cin(c0, c1), cph, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1))), co(cin(c0, c1), chj, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1)))), wss(cin(c0, c1), cfv(cort, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1)))))
  sseqtr4i(cin(c0, c1), cfv(cort, cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1))), co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, c1))
  sstri(cin(c0, c1), co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, c1), c1)
  inss2(c0, c1)
  chub2i(c1, cfv(cort, c0))
  choccli(c0)
  chdmm3i(c0, c1)
  osumi(cin(c0, c1), cin(c0, cfv(cort, c1)))
  chincli(c0, c1)
  chincli(c0, cfv(cort, c1))
  choccli(c1)
}

  eqeq2i(co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), cph, c1), co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), chj, c1), co(c0, chj, c1))

  eqtri(co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), chj, c1), co(c1, chj, cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0)))), co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0))), chj, c1))
  oveq1i(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), chj, c1, cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0))))
  ineq2i(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1)), co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0)))
  chjcomi(cfv(cort, c0), cfv(cort, c1))
  chjcomi(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0))), c1)
  chincli(c0, co(cfv(cort, c1), chj, cfv(cort, c0)))

  pjoml4i(c1, c0)

  mpbii(wceq(co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)), wss(co(c0, chj, c1), co(c0, cph, c1)), wss(co(cin(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1))), cph, c1), co(c0, cph, c1)))

  inss1(c0, co(cfv(cort, c0), chj, cfv(cort, c1)))

blocks.name: osum
blocks.content: If two closed subspaces of a Hilbert space are orthogonal, their subspace sum equals their subspace join. Lemma 3 of [Kalmbach] p. 67. (Contributed by NM, 31-Oct-2005.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm osum(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cch), wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1))), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)))
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cch), wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)))
  dedth2h(c0, chba, c1, chba, wcel(c0, cch), wcel(c1, cch), wi(wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1))), wi(wss(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1))), wi(wss(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)))), wceq(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))))))
  imbi12d(wceq(c0, cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch))), wss(c0, cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1)), wss(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1)))
  sseq1(c0, cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, c1))
  eqeq12d(co(c0, cph, c1), co(c0, chj, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1), wceq(c0, cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch))))
  oveq1(c0, cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1)
  oveq1(c0, cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1)
  imbi12d(wceq(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), wss(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, c1)), wceq(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1)), wss(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)))), wceq(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)))))
  sseq2d(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cfv(cort, c1), cfv(cort, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), wceq(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))))
  fveq2(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)), cort)
  eqeq12d(co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, c1), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), co(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))), wceq(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch))))
  oveq2(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)), cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cph)
  oveq2(c1, cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)), cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), chj)
  osumi(cif(c0, chba, wcel(c0, cch)), cif(c1, chba, wcel(c1, cch)))
  ifchhv(c0)
  ifchhv(c1)
}

thm osum(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ CH ∧ c1 ∈ CH ∧ c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1))→(c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1))
} = {
  3impia(c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ CH, c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), (c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1))
  dedth2h(c0, chba, c1, chba, c0 ∈ CH, c1 ∈ CH, (c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1)→(c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1)), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)⊆(_|_ ` c1)→(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]c1)=(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]c1)), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)⊆(_|_ ` if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))→(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))=(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))))
  imbi12d(c0 = if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), c0 ⊆(_|_ ` c1), (c0[+H]c1)=(c0[vH]c1), if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)⊆(_|_ ` c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]c1)=(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]c1))
  sseq1(c0, if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), (_|_ ` c1))
  eqeq12d((c0[+H]c1), (c0[vH]c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]c1), c0 = if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H))
  oveq1(c0, if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), cph, c1)
  oveq1(c0, if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), chj, c1)
  imbi12d(c1 = if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H), if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)⊆(_|_ ` c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]c1)=(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]c1), if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)⊆(_|_ ` if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H)), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))=(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H)))
  sseq2d(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), (_|_ ` c1), (_|_ ` if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H)), c1 = if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))
  fveq2(c1, if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H), cort)
  eqeq12d((if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]c1), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[+H]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H)), (if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H)[vH]if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H)), c1 = if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))
  oveq2(c1, if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H), if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), cph)
  oveq2(c1, if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H), if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), chj)
  osumi(if(c0 ∈ CH, c0, ~H), if(c1 ∈ CH, c1, ~H))
  ifchhv(c0)
  ifchhv(c1)
}

blocks.name: spansnji
blocks.content: The subspace sum of a closed subspace and a one-dimensional subspace equals their join. (Proof suggested by Eric Schechter 1-Jun-2004.) (Contributed by NM, 1-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm spansnji(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))), co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))))
  -| wcel(c0, cch)
  -| wcel(c1, chba)
} = {
  eqtr2i(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))), co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))), cfv(cort, cfv(cort, co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))))))
  shjshsi(c0, cfv(cspn, csn(c1)))
  chshii(cfv(cspn, csn(c1)))
  spansnchi(c1)
  ococi(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))))
  eqeltri(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))), cch, co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))))
  3eqtrri(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))), co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), cfv(cspn, cun(c0, csn(c1))), co(cfv(cspn, c0), cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1))))
  eqtr4i(co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), cfv(cspn, cun(c0, csn(c1))), cfv(cspn, cun(c0, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))))
  3eqtrri(co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), cfv(cspn, cun(c0, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), co(cfv(cspn, c0), cph, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))))
  spanuni(c0, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))
  ax-mp(wss(csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)), chba), wcel(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1), chba))
  snssi(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1), chba)
  oveq1i(cfv(cspn, c0), cph, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))), c0)
  ax-mp(wceq(co(c0, cph, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1)))), co(c0, chj, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))))), wss(c0, cfv(cort, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))))))
  spansnpji(c0, c1)
  osumi(c0, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))))
  spanunsni(c0, c1)
  spanuni(c0, csn(c1))
  chssii(c0)
  ax-mp(wss(csn(c1), chba), wcel(c1, chba))
  snssi(c1, chba)
  oveq1i(cfv(cspn, c0), cph, cfv(cspn, csn(c1)), c0)
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cspn, c0), c0), wcel(c0, csh))
  chshii(c0)
  spanid(c0)
  chjcli(c0, cfv(cspn, csn(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))))
  spansnchi(cfv(cfv(cpjh, cfv(cort, c0)), c1))
  pjhclii(cfv(cort, c0), c1)
  choccli(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm spansnji(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0[+H](span ` { c1 }))=(c0[vH](span ` { c1 }))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ CH
  ⊣ c1 ∈ ~H
} = {
  eqtr2i((c0[+H](span ` { c1 })), (c0[vH](span ` { c1 })), (_|_ `(_|_ `(c0[+H](span ` { c1 })))))
  shjshsi(c0, (span ` { c1 }))
  chshii((span ` { c1 }))
  spansnchi(c1)
  ococi((c0[+H](span ` { c1 })))
  eqeltri((c0[+H](span ` { c1 })), cch, (c0[vH](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})))
  3eqtrri((c0[+H](span ` { c1 })), (c0[vH](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), (span `(c0 ⋃ { c1 })), ((span ` c0)[+H](span ` { c1 })))
  eqtr4i((c0[vH](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), (span `(c0 ⋃ { c1 })), (span `(c0 ⋃ {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})))
  3eqtrri((c0[vH](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), (span `(c0 ⋃ {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), ((span ` c0)[+H](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), (c0[+H](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})))
  spanuni(c0, {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})
  ax-mp({((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)} ⊆ ~H, ((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)∈ ~H)
  snssi(((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1), chba)
  oveq1i((span ` c0), cph, (span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)}), c0)
  ax-mp((c0[+H](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)}))=(c0[vH](span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})), c0 ⊆(_|_ `(span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)})))
  spansnpji(c0, c1)
  osumi(c0, (span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)}))
  spanunsni(c0, c1)
  spanuni(c0, { c1 })
  chssii(c0)
  ax-mp({ c1 } ⊆ ~H, c1 ∈ ~H)
  snssi(c1, chba)
  oveq1i((span ` c0), cph, (span ` { c1 }), c0)
  ax-mp((span ` c0)= c0, c0 ∈ SH)
  chshii(c0)
  spanid(c0)
  chjcli(c0, (span ` {((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1)}))
  spansnchi(((projh `(_|_ ` c0))` c1))
  pjhclii((_|_ ` c0), c1)
  choccli(c0)
}

thm spansnj(class c0, class c1) {

blocks.name: nonbooli
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice with two or more dimensions fails the distributive law and therefore cannot be a Boolean algebra. This counterexample demonstrates a condition where ` ( ( H i^i F ) vH ( H i^i G ) ) = 0H ` but ` ( H i^i ( F vH G ) ) =/= 0H ` . The antecedent specifies that the vectors ` A ` and ` B ` are nonzero and non-colinear. The last three hypotheses assign one-dimensional subspaces to ` F ` , ` G ` , and ` H ` . (Contributed by NM, 1-Nov-2005.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.content: Hilbert space has the covering property (using spans of singletons to represent atoms). Exercise 5 of [Kalmbach] p. 153. (Contributed by NM, 7-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.content: Hilbert space has the covering property (using spans of singletons to represent atoms). Exercise 5 of [Kalmbach] p. 153. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
